citation.article-title: Studies on the phylogenetic relationships of melanogenic marine bacteria: proposal of Marinomonas mediterranea sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Marinomonas mediterranea sp. nov.

Marinomonas mediterranea (med.i.terr.an'e.a. L. gen. n. mediterranea of the Mediterranean, as the type strain was isolated from the Mediterranean Sea in the region of Murcia, on the south-eastern Spanish coast)
Most of the taxonomic characteristics of this strain are summarized in Table 3.
Cells are Gram-negative rods, motile by a single polar flagellum.
Does not grow under anaerobic conditions.
Shows lipase and weak gelatinase activities.
Able to metabolize D-glucose, D-mannose, D-sorbitol, citrate, β-hydroxybutyrate, succinate, glycerol and malate.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 46.3 ± 0.9 mol%, as determined by total hydrolysis and HPLC.
Produces melanins and contains a pluripotent polyphenol oxidase and a tyrosinase activated by SDS.
The GenBank accession number for the 16s rRNA sequence of strain MMB-1T is AF063027.
The type strain of Marinomonas mediterranea is MMB-1T (=CECT4803T=ATCC 700492T).
